page.title: 16 Westinghouse Factory 1.
page.content: The largest factory in Chippenham belongs to{Westinghouse}Brake and Signal Company. The factory has been in the town for about one hundred years and was originally built to make brakes and signals for the Great Western Railway. It now belongs to the Hawker Siddley Group and employs over two thousand people. It is divided into four separate parts making different things. The largest part is{Signals.}This employs about 1000 people, designing and making coloured light signals for railways. Half of what they produce is exported to other countries all over the world.
